New Day's Team of experts understood where I was in my life and what I had sacrificed all these many years. Mitch was the perfect match for us and he made the entire process both comprehensive and smooth from start to finish. New Day's willingness to stay on task with us through some slight changes (location, home value, and rising home interest rates); was an unexpected delight. Kudos to the entire team (Mitch, Jake, and the Realtor assigned to us "Dakota"); they worked well together through the entire process. Many Thanks...

title: NewDay (ND) wasn't a great experience…
text: NewDay (ND) wasn't a great experience for me.  I appreciated the efforts of my loan officer, Matt.  He was responsive and a reliable communicator.  It seemed (by ND policy) he was directed or compelled to reach out nearly every day during our refi process.  That got old very quickly.At the end of the process, NewDay' best interest rate was a full 1 point higher than where we actually ended up (not at ND).  In addition, they were not able to provide me with the cash I needed to realize via our refi transaction.Further, they insisted on my paying off a vehicle, which I co-signed on for my daughter, who had been making regular monthly payments for almost 2 years with no late or missed payments.  Ridiculous!I was not convinced ND had my best interests as a priority.  If so, their rate would have been much more competitive and citing corrections to the above noted issues, I would have "done the deal" with them.

text: I worked with Brendan Cavanagh for the just completed equity refinance on my residence, and I was very pleased with the attention I received during the approval process. We hit a bump in the road during the process on my homeowners insurance. The annual premium was not paid in a timely manner, admittedly this was partly my fault, but I did make it known in time for action to be taken. This did not happen and the result was that my insurance was suspended, my insurance lapsed, then the payment was schedule for December 2022 rather than December 2021. I noticed this immediately, but it took intervention from Brendan to get the issue resolved and my closing was delayed for several weeks. A big thank you to Brendan for his proactive involvement!!I also have a recommendation for the future. The main reason I took out equity in the refinance was too eliminate credit card debt. Checks I received to pay creditors were made out to the creditor names listed in my credit reports, not the actual payee information in my monthly statements. All payments are now successfully completed, but two payments took longer to clear than the others. I mailed all payments on the same day, all had payment coupons with them, and several went to the same city/state. I do realize that some creditors are slower to process than others, but I can't help but think that having the payee name be exactly correct would help. My recommendation is that part of the process include getting correct payee information.Closing signing was excellent and the documents I signed were well explained.My overall rating is 5 stars to Brendan and 4 stars to the process.

text: This was my third time to refinance with New Day and it will probably be my last. Primary reason is that I need to start building equity in my home. Generally, he was timely in his responses and kept me informed on the status of my loan application.  I realize my account was probably not the only one he was assigned. He answered all of my questions, even if I didn't always like the answer. I am satisfied with my monthly mortgage payment, this time.  Being able to bundle my personal and auto loan payments, will help me tremendously. My previous refinance had an issue (loan estimate did not include my Windstorm and Hail Policy in my estimated monthly escrow payment) that I was able to identify during the application process. Adding the cost of this policy resulted in a higher monthly mortgage payment.  This was an issue for me as I was under the impression that a lower monthly payment was New Day's primary marketing point to veterans. Negative Comments:During the application process, from the first phone call to the last phone call on 3 Jan, I had been told that I would receive a significant cash payment at closing.  During the first phone call from Joe, I believe I was told something to the effect that based on my finances I may receive as much as $20K. The exact statement(s) can be confirmed in your recorded phone calls with me.  My 2 Dec Loan Estimate showed a reduced cash payment amount of $11,846 but still significant to me nonetheless. I didn't retain copies of the other loan estimates I reviewed but believe they too showed me still receiving a cash payment at closing. I can't recall the actual amount but believe it was $3K - $4K. On 3 Jan, Joe contacted me that the cash payment at closing was being completely eliminated.  And while I somewhat understand the rationale used by your management team, my expectations had wrongfully been raised since the initial phone call with the proverbial rug being pulled out from underneath me. While I realistically never believed the $20K cash payment would ever happen, follow on discussions with Joe continued leaving me with the impression that I would still receive something. That was until Joe called me on 3 Jan and told me no cash payment would be paid at closing. As I told Joe, I would have preferred that a cash payment not even be mentioned until a complete and more accurate assessment of my finances could have been done. I have no reason to believe that the management team was not doing everything possible to make the numbers work but I don't feel real good about how this ended.

title: From process start to closing in 15 days . . .
text: I have considered my home refinancing process in four steps: marketing; qualification; execution/closing; and follow-through. Since interest rates have been constantly falling, I have been inundated with offers to complete a VA Refinance (refi). Almost all offers in the mail from other companies were poorly constructed. NewDay USA did the absolute best job of clearly presenting what they were offering. However, their marketing approach is where I downgraded them from five to four stars. I have a hearing impairment and I avoid phone calls. I requested information from NewDay on their web site explaining my hearing problem and asked for more information by email instead of phone. I received a response by PHONE and email within 24 hours. I did not answer the phone call and by e-mail again explained my hearing problem. I got no response. This happened twice. Finally, the third different account executive (AE) agreed to proceed by email and from that point forward the process went smoothly. I can only assume that some NewDay AEs do not know how to type. After I had begun the refi process with them, NewDay continued to bombard me with mailings and phone calls. I can understand the mailings due to the latency of the USPS. However, I must have received over ten phone solicitations from NewDay AFTER I had agreed to refi with them. I knew it was NewDay because the callers left voice mail messages. They need a better tracking system to call off the hounds!!! Once I was connected with the AE who handled my refi, the qualification and paperwork phase was outstanding! My AE honored my request to work primarily through email. She gave me frequent updates throughout the process and patiently answered all of my questions. The closing was painless. NewDay scheduled a closing notary to come to our house and she arrived on-time and was very competent. The closing took one hour to complete. My initial contact with the AE who handled my refi was on Jan 5. The closing occurred on Jan 20 and I confirmed my old mortgage was paid off on Jan 25. I cannot comment yet on the follow-through. Although I have received notification that my previous mortgage has been paid off, I have not yet received instructions for beginning payments on the new loan. This is not a criticism since I realize the first payment due date is over 30 days away. Overall, the entire refi process with NewDay was highly efficient and painless (with minor irritations of consistent marketing phone calls.) In addition, through research on the web I have not found a lower interest rate than the one I obtained. I would highly recommend NewDay to any veteran eligible for an interest rate reduction refi.

text: Thank you setting up an easy refinance process for Veterans. The process flowed well. Jake did an outstanding job guiding me, and informing me throughout the process. Therefore, i have two recommendations for your consideration:  1. Overcoming anxiety in a totally online and voice process, especially with Veterans with PTSD. Senior Leaders conduct outreach with customers at a certain point in the process. Hey, this is a real Company, and I'm here to help (i am not referring to Sr. Leaders taking calls to help people with financial issues) Availability on Linkedin (example). An organization is more than just the face and the words on it's website.2. Customer support. I had nobody else but Jake to call on closing day. You lose all credibility when you stumble reading a script. On closing day, I had a question on a Florida requirement. I called, and emailed. The only voice i could connect to was voicemail. Fortunately, i was able to connect with the State of Florida Attorney General office to discuss the Florida requirement.
